element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: The algorithm creates a buffer area using an ancillary threshold layer.

image.description: Example. Origin layer: channel network. Threshold parameter layer: slope. Threshold type: ansolute. Absolute threshold: 0.15

element.name: FEATURES
element.text: The raster layer whith the features to buffer. This should be represented by non-zero values. All cells not representing a feature to buffer should have a zero value or the no-data value of the layer

element.name: VALUES
element.text: The layer contaning the threshold variable

element.name: THRESHOLD
element.text: This layer contains the threshold that should be applied in each cell.

element.name: METHOD
element.text:
There are two available methods.
In both cases, the buffer expands from each feature cell towards the surrounding cells, stopping only when the values of a surrounding cell does not meet the condition set by the chosen method . * Absolute: surrounding cells will become part of the buffer if the value of the threshold parameter in that cell is lower than the threshold.. * Relative to the value of the cell: surrounding cells will become part of the buffer if the difference between its value and the value of the initial feature cell in the threshold layer is less than the threshold.

element.name: ABSOLUTE_THRESHOLD
element.text: If no threshold layer is used, you should enter a global threshold in this field

element.name: BUFFER_LAYER
element.text: The buffer layer, containing the follwoing values * 0 value: cells outside of the buffer. * Value 1: original feature cells * Value 2: cells in the buffer.
